Renderable.cpp

Contains implementation for CRenderable

Functions
CRenderable
CRenderable::CRenderable(
IRenderSubMesh 
*
pSubMesh,
IRenderMaterial 
*
pFrontMaterial,
IRenderMaterial 
*
pBackMaterial,
DirectX::
XMMATRIX 
&
mat
) : m_xform(mat)

Creates a renderable object. A Renderable is a IRenderSubMesh paired with a set of materials and a shader.

Parameters
pSubMesh
IRenderSubMesh*

Render submesh pFrontMaterial Material to apply to front facing polygons pBackMaterial Material to apply to back facing polygons

mat
DirectX::XMMATRIX&

world matrix to apply

Module

{Link:import Rendering.Caustic.Renderable;{Rendering/Caustic/Renderable.cpp}}

*

vector<CRefObj<ILight>> 
&
lights,
IRenderCtx 
*
pRenderCtx,
IRenderMaterial 
*
pRenderMaterial,
D3D11_CULL_MODE 
cullmode
)

Renders either the front or back faces of a mesh

Parameters
pRenderer
IRenderer*

graphics device

lights
std::vector<CRefObj<ILight>>&

List of lights to apply

pRenderCtx
IRenderCtx*

Rendering context

pRenderMaterial
IRenderMaterial*

Material to apply

cullmode
D3D11_CULL_MODE

Culling mode to apply
